intro: Dicera craspedum, commonly known as the spiked hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and serrated leaves. It typically grows in meadows and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soil. Dicera craspedum is an annual plant that blooms from late spring to early summer.
